p: Principal component analysis (PCA) shows that modern and future storm surges are strongly impacted by TC radius of maximum wind (RMW) values, similar to preindustrial-era results (850â€“1800; ref. 4). Level amplification factors (LAFs) of modern return periods of RMW for the CCSM4 and IPSL models suggest larger RMW values in the future ( Fig. S1). An increase in future RMW values was previously suggested in ref. 29. Larger RMW values may lead to higher wind speeds at fixed points from the storm center, which may lead to larger storm surges.
